  "description": "Chef Eros &amp; Co. is the story of an African Hut built on a Mountain of Dreams. With five brands and counting, we have consistently delivered an unforgettable culinary experience. We are a fully integrated food brand specializing in confectionery, culinary art and catering, tailored to meet the needs of our diverse clientele. At Chef Eros &amp; Co, we represent a true touch of Nigerian Luxury.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Buyer / Purchasing Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and detail oriented Buyer/Purchasing Officer to support our procurement operations at Chef Eros &amp; Co.
	The ideal candidate will assist in sourcing quality ingredients, packaging materials, and kitchen supplies, ensuring that all purchases align with our brand standards and operational needs.


Key Responsibilities


	Purchase all raw materials, ingredients, packaging, and operational supplies required across the company.
	Follow up on orders and ensure timely delivery of goods to meet kitchen and production needs.
	Liaise with the procurement team to fulfill needs for kitchen, bakery, catering, and operations teams.
	Assist in checking delivered items from vendors for quality, quantity, and compliance with orders.
	Help monitor inventory levels and notify supervisors when restocking is needed.
	Assist in identifying trusted suppliers for fresh produce, dry goods, kitchen equipment, packaging, and other food related items.
	Compare supplier pricing and suggest more cost effective alternatives when necessary.
	Ensure that sourced items meet company and regulatory standards.
	File invoices, delivery notes and support the team with purchase documentation.


Job Requirement


	SSCE or OND in Business Administration, Procurement, or related field.
	1 &ndash; 2 years in a similar role; experience in the food, restaurant, or hospitality sector is an advantage.
	Basic knowledge of purchasing and inventory processes.
	Strong communication and negotiation skill
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Basic Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets skills
	Ability to work under pressure in a fast paced environment.


Method of Application
Interested candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to:&nbsp;humancapitalmgt@cheferos.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

	Assist in identifying trusted suppliers for fresh produce, dry goods, kitchen equipment, packaging, and other food related items.
	Compare supplier pricing and suggest more cost effective alternatives when necessary.
	Ensure that sourced items meet company and regulatory standards.
	File invoices, delivery notes and support the team with purchase documentation.


Job Requirement


	SSCE or OND in Business Administration, Procurement, or related field.
	1 – 2 years in a similar role; experience in the food, restaurant, or hospitality sector is an advantage.
	Basic knowledge of purchasing and inventory processes.
	Strong communication and negotiation skill
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Basic Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets skills
	Ability to work under pressure in a fast paced environment.


Method of Application
Interested candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: humancapitalmgt@cheferos.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Brand Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Brand &amp; Marketing

Job Summary


	The Brand Manager is responsible for elevating and protecting the identity of our luxury hospitality brand.
	This role ensures that every guest touchpoint from accommodation and dining to spa experiences reflects the brand&rsquo;s promise of excellence and sophistication.
	The Brand Manager will lead initiatives to strengthen brand positioning, drive customer loyalty, and deliver exceptional experiences that set us apart in the luxury hospitality industry.


Key Responsibilities
Brand Strategy &amp; Development:


	Define and communicate a clear, compelling luxury brand identity across all properties and services.
	Develop and implement long-term brand strategies that enhance guest perception and market positioning.
	Conduct competitive analysis and market research to identify opportunities for brand growth in the luxury hospitality sector.


Guest Experience &amp; Consistency:


	Partner with Operations, Guest Services, and Housekeeping to ensure every guest interaction is aligned with brand standards.
	Maintain and regularly update brand guidelines, ensuring consistent use across menus, signage, uniforms, marketing materials, and online presence.
	Lead brand audits to ensure service delivery reflects the brand promise.


Campaign &amp; Activation Management:


	Design and oversee brand campaigns, seasonal promotions, and luxury experiences to engage and attract guests.
	Collaborate with the marketing and sales teams to create compelling storytelling content (social media, PR, digital campaigns).
	Partner with influencers, media outlets, and luxury lifestyle brands to enhance visibility.


Performance &amp; Insights:


	Analyze guest feedback, online reviews, and market data to measure brand perception and recommend improvements.
	Track KPIs such as guest satisfaction, repeat bookings, and engagement with brand campaigns.


Budget &amp; Stakeholder Management:


	Manage brand marketing budgets, ensuring effective use of resources to maximize ROI.
	Collaborate with vendors, creative agencies, and cross-functional teams to execute brand initiatives seamlessly.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Marketing, Brand Management, Communications, or a related field.
	5+ years of experience in brand management or marketing within the luxury hospitality, lifestyle, or service industry.

	Strong understanding of guest expectations and trends in luxury travel, dining, and wellness.
	Excellent communication, storytelling, and visual branding skills.
	Proficiency in digital marketing tools, social media management, and analytics platforms.


Key Competencies:


	Luxury Mindset: Deep appreciation for premium service, attention to detail, and creating memorable guest experiences.
	Strategic Thinking: Ability to anticipate market trends and position the brand ahead of competitors.
	Creativity &amp; Innovation: Strong eye for design, aesthetics, and unique brand activations.
	Collaboration: Skilled at working cross-functionally to align operations, service, and marketing.
	Analytical Ability: Data-driven decision-maker with a focus on results and continuous improvement.

title: Job Openings at Teal Harmony Limited
content:
Teal Harmony Limited is an established renovation and interior design company based in Nigeria. We provide services that are tailored to covering every aspect of our clients’ projects. We pride ourselves with creating successful and beautiful spaces because we pay attention to detail, a proper understanding of our clients tastes and ambitions, whilst ensuring awareness of timelines and budgets.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Interior Architect

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Head of Operations / Managing Director

Role Summary
     

            
    




	The Senior Interior Architect is responsible for leading the creative, technical, and executional aspects of interior design projects from concept to completion.
	The role requires combining architectural knowledge with interior design expertise to create functional, aesthetic, and brand-aligned spaces.
	The Senior Interior Architect will oversee design teams, liaise with clients, collaborate with the showroom and furniture manufacturing units, and ensure high-quality project delivery within timelines and budgets.


Key Responsibilities
Design & Project Leadership:


	Lead the conceptualization, design development, and execution of interior architecture projects (residential, commercial, and bespoke).
	Translate client briefs into innovative design solutions that balance aesthetics, functionality, and cost-efficiency.
	Prepare and present design proposals, mood boards, material boards, and 3D visualizations for client approval.
	Supervise the preparation of detailed architectural drawings, specifications, and construction documents.
	Coordinate with project managers, engineers, quantity surveyors, and contractors to ensure smooth implementation.


Client Engagement & Business Support:


	Serve as the primary design contact for clients, ensuring needs are fully understood and expectations exceeded.
	Conduct site visits, measurements, and inspections throughout project lifecycle.
	Provide expert design input for showroom layouts, displays, and furniture integration to support sales.
	Collaborate with the furniture manufacturing team to design bespoke furniture pieces tailored to projects.


Team Leadership & Mentorship:


	Supervise junior architects, designers, and interns, providing guidance, feedback, and mentoring.
	Review and approve design deliverables from the team to ensure accuracy and quality.
	Foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement within the design department.


Quality & Compliance:


	Ensure all designs comply with building codes, safety regulations, and industry standards.
	Conduct quality checks on design execution, materials, and finishes.
	Manage budgets and timelines to deliver projects within scope.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture, Interior Architecture, or Interior Design.
	Professional certification and registration (e.g., ARCON, NIA, or equivalent) preferred.
	Minimum of 7–10 years of progressive design experience, with at least 3 years in a senior/leadership role.
	Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in high-end residential, commercial, and bespoke interior projects.
	Proficiency in design software (AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp, 3ds Max, V-Ray, Lumion, Adobe Creative Suite).
	Knowledge of materials, finishes, lighting design, and furniture detailing.
	Strong project management skills – ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
	Excellent client-facing, communication, and presentation skills.
	Creativity, innovation, and attention to detail.


Key Competencies:


	Leadership and team management
	Creative problem-solving and conceptual thinking
	Strong technical drawing and detailing skills
	Client relationship management
	Time and budget management
	Collaboration across showroom, projects, and manufacturing arms
	Ability to balance design flair with practicality.


Application Closing Date: 21st September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: itiyoha@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Project Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Head of Operations / Managing Director

Role Summary


	The Project Manager is responsible for planning, coordinating, and delivering interior design and furniture projects from inception to completion.
	The role requires strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills to manage timelines, budgets, resources, and client expectations.
	The Project Manager will liaise with architects, designers, procurement, manufacturing, contractors, and clients to ensure projects are executed to the highest quality standards, within budget, and on schedule.


Key Responsibilities
Project Planning & Coordination:


	Develop project plans, scope, timelines, budgets, and resource allocation.
	Coordinate with design, showroom, and manufacturing teams to align deliverables with project requirements.
	Prepare work schedules and monitor progress to ensure timely delivery.
	Oversee procurement of materials, furniture, and finishes for projects.


Execution & Monitoring:


	Supervise on-site activities, ensuring quality workmanship, adherence to drawings, and compliance with safety standards.
	Manage contractors, artisans, and subcontractors to ensure smooth operations.
	Anticipate and resolve issues, delays, or conflicts that may impact project progress.
	Track project milestones, costs, and variations, and provide regular status updates to management and clients.


Client & Stakeholder Management:


	Serve as the main point of contact for clients during project execution.
	Provide regular progress reports, site updates, and feedback sessions with clients.
	Ensure all client requirements are understood, documented, and delivered.
	Manage change requests, approvals, and variations in scope effectively.


Team & Resource Management:


	Work closely with architects, interior designers, and factory teams to align project execution with creative vision.
	Supervise site supervisors, artisans, and other project staff.
	Coordinate with HR/Admin for manpower scheduling and staff deployment.


Quality & Compliance:


	Ensure strict adherence to design specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations.
	Conduct regular site inspections and quality control checks.
	Close out projects with final inspections, snag lists, and client sign-off.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Project Management, Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field.
	5–8 years of experience managing interior design, construction, or furniture manufacturing projects.
	Professional certifications (PMP, PRINCE2, or equivalent) are an advantage.
	Strong knowledge of project management tools and software (MS Project, Primavera, or equivalent).
	Experience working with multidisciplinary teams (design, procurement, factory, showroom).
	Excellent leadership, organizational, and multitasking skills.
	Strong negotiation and problem-solving skills.
	Effective communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Key Competencies:


	Leadership & decision-making
	Budget & cost management
	Time management & scheduling
	Stakeholder & client engagement
	Risk management & problem-solving
	Quality assurance & attention to detail
	Team collaboration across different business units.


Application Closing Date: 21st September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: itiyoha@gmail.com  using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Human Resources and Admin Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	The Human Resources & Administration Manager is responsible for overseeing all aspects of human capital management and administrative operations within the organization.
	This includes managing HR policies, recruitment, performance management, employee relations, training and development, and ensuring smooth administrative support across the interior design projects, showroom operations, and furniture manufacturing unit.
	The role requires a balance of strategic HR leadership and hands-on administrative management to support a dynamic and creative business environment.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources Management:


	Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and procedures aligned with company goals.
	Lead the full recruitment cycle (job postings, interviews, selection, onboarding) for design, showroom, and factory staff.
	Oversee performance management, including setting KPIs, conducting appraisals, and supporting career development.
	Drive employee engagement and retention initiatives tailored to diverse teams (designers, sales staff, artisans, factory workers).
	Manage employee relations, grievance handling, conflict resolution, and disciplinary procedures.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health and safety standards, and other regulatory requirements.
	Maintain and update HR records, contracts, and employee data in line with best practices.
	Coordinate training programs to build staff capacity (design software, customer service, factory safety, etc.).


Administration & Operations Support:


	Oversee administrative services including office management, logistics, procurement of office supplies, and facility management.
	Support showroom administration – ensuring a conducive work environment, visitor experience, and customer-facing readiness.
	Provide HR and admin support to project teams to ensure smooth execution of interior design and manufacturing projects.
	Manage staff schedules, leave administration, and attendance tracking across departments.
	Supervise administrative staff, drivers, cleaners, and other support personnel.
	Coordinate company-wide communications, staff meetings, and reporting systems.


Strategic Contributions:


	Partner with management to forecast staffing needs for new projects, showroom growth, and factory expansion.
	Contribute to organizational development, culture building, and change management initiatives.
	Implement HR metrics and reporting to track workforce productivity and administrative efficiency.
	Support succession planning and leadership development initiatives.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, Industrial Relations, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 – 7 years HR & Admin experience, preferably in manufacturing, retail, or project-based industries.
	Professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD) is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of labor laws, HR best practices, and workplace compliance.
	Proven experience managing diverse teams (creative staff, showroom/sales personnel, and factory workers).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office tools.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced, creative, and hands-on environment.


Application Closing Date: 16th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: itiyoha@gmail.com  using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
